title: How Microscopy Enabled Laboratory Fusion
content: The first demonstration of fusion in the laboratory [1] on December 5, 2022, was enabled by the National Ignition Facility’s (NIF) ability to operate with its final optics exposed to energy densities expected to initiate and grow laser-induced damage. The design of the NIF exchanges regular damage to the laser’s final optics for 300% (and increasing) more energy delivered to its targets.
